p: This demonstrates that the isolated use of 2,4-D in concentrations of 0.50–0.75 mg/L, with calli grown in dark conditions, or BA applied at 2.0 mg/L in the presence of light may result in an expressive gain in fresh weight or productivity of calli obtained in in vitro conditions in P. amarus. The proliferation rates in darkness with 0.75 mg/L and in light with 2.0 mg/L of BA were 22.1× and 12.0×, respectively.
